chargeHist.descr: Stalking - Victim is Under 18 Yrs of Age

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John F Maruska in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 14CF44 AND 14CF310


9:02  Court relates and gives appearances.

14CF44:
Count #1:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.
Count #2:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #3:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Sentence hearing set for 12/23/14 at 10:30 AM for one hour.
PSI ordered.
Bond to continue in its present form.


14CF310:  
Count #1:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.
Count #2:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.

Rice Lake Police Dept. case 14-238: 
State moves to read in.  Court grants motion.
10/10/14 Letter to Counsel from Judge Boyle regarding Defendant's Motions.
plea of not guilty and defense motions. Defendant's.

Defendant John F Maruska in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.


8:30  Court relates and gives appearances.   Defense has filed a motion to dismiss.  Atty. Davis indicates he wishes to withdraw that motion at this time and to proceed with the preliminary hearing.
8:31  K.G. called, sworn, direct by State.  Witness identifies defendant.
8:35  Cross by Atty. Davis.  
8:48  Court questions witness.
8:50  State asks for bind-over.
Court finds probable cause.  Bound over.
Information filed.
Defendant pleads NG to counts #1 and 2.

Defense asks for 30 days to file any motions. Court grants.
Bond to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant John F Maruska in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  Defendant John F Maruska in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendants motion to amend the cash bond. State relates and objects.   Court finds the bond previously set is appropriate and denies the motion.
State moved to amend the Criminal Complaint to attach a copy of a certified bond. Court granted. Copy of the certified bond was attached to the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must have no contact with K.M.G. dob 07/14/1997.
Must have no contact with Kellie A.

Defendant John F Maruska in court with attorney John G. Hinde (for today only).  Defendant John F Maruska in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense waives formal reading of complaint.
State moves to amend complaint to add certified copy of bail bond.  Court approves.


  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
